title: Support for multi-module project layout in codestarts
body:
### Description

It would be nice if a custom Quarkus platform could define a custom `project` codestart (i.e. a codestart of type `project`) which defines a given project structure, where the Quarkus app is in a subdirectory (i.e. a submodule in a Maven multi-module project). Thus, the project codestart would be able to control into which directory (the project directory itself or some given subdirectory), the Quarkus application gets generated. All other codestarts would then generate files relative to this given directory.

Otherwise, for multi-module projects of this kind, the Quarkus project generator can only be used to generate the Quarkus application submodule and the custom platform would have to provide its own independent tooling to generate the rest of the project structure. Alternatively, the custom platform can override all Quarkus provided codestarts to generate files into the desired subdirectory.

### Implementation ideas

Possibly the `project` codestart could define a dedicated property in its `codestart.yml` file with the name of the subdirectory to generate into.
